title: narrow web font
content:
I have nó idea what font this is.  
I dunno the official term, but this is a web-font like Verdana, Trebuchet. I mean at the website [http://www.tefalgezondenlekker.nl](http://web.archive.org/web/20091031101534/http:/www.tefalgezondenlekker.nl/ "http://www.tefalgezondenlekker.nl") I can select seperate characters (the red headings), it’s not a gif or jpeg. I could not find a fontname in the page source.  
Thanks upfront!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091031101534im_/http:/typophile.com/files/webfont_3827.jpg)
author: elzosmid

comments.content: Maybe you can download the swf of that font to see what is it.

Its Delicious:  
 [http://www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/delicious.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091031101534/http:/www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/delicious.html "http://www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/delicious.html")

You can select it because they’re using sIFR:  
 [http://www.mikeindustries.com/blog/sifr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091031101534/http:/www.mikeindustries.com/blog/sifr/ "http://www.mikeindustries.com/blog/sifr/")

Thanks!  
I see I got some catching up to do, concerning web-font technology.
